title._content: Pathway through the upper garden late summer (September 28)

description._content:
Despite an air frost five days ago and several inches of rain this week due to tropical storm Nadine, we still have plenty of flowers today as summer meets autumn.

During our garden open day on 23rd September the rain held off until 1pm. Most people had seen the weather forecast  and therefore came in the morning!   We were delighted to receive a total of 111 visitors and, together with donations, raised £436 for the charity "Leukaemia and Lymphoma Research UK''. 

We were very pleased that the  Walsall Mayor Councillor Dennis Anson and Mayoress Kate Anson were able to visit the garden towards the end of the afternoon and they seemed to really enjoy themselves, despite the rain!  

Since 2006 we have welcomed more than 9,000 visitors to our garden open days and we are sincerely grateful to them all for raising over £28,400 for our named charities.
